name: Roasted Sweet Potato Dip
author: lutzflcat
summary: You may have had hummus, but have you ever had sweet potato dip? It's similar, but different. Serve with tortilla chips, fresh veggies, breadsticks, pita chips, spread on crostini, or use as a base on a flatbread pizza. Just use your imagination, the sky's the limit!
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil
Place the potato on the baking sheet, and using a fork, repeatedly pierce the top of the sweet potato to keep it from exploding in the oven
Bake in the preheated oven until sweet potato is fork-tender and cooked through, 45 to 50 minutes
Cut sweet potato in half once cool enough to handle, scoop out the flesh, and place in a food processor or blender
Add cilantro, lime juice, tahini, garlic, cumin, salt, and red pepper flakes
Blend until well combined and smooth
Taste, and adjust seasoning if necessary
Spoon dip into a bowl, garnish with chopped pistachios, and serve
